intro: Columnea chiricana, commonly known as the red-tailed columnea, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are trailing or semi-woody. Columnea chiricana is popular in horticulture for its vibrant blooms and is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
